014package org.jdbi.v3.guice;
015
016import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
017
018import com.google.inject.AbstractModule;
019import org.jdbi.v3.core.Jdbi;
020import org.jdbi.v3.guice.internal.InternalGlobalJdbiModule;
021import org.jdbi.v3.guice.internal.InternalJdbiBinder;
022import org.jdbi.v3.guice.internal.JdbiGlobal;
023
024import static com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkNotNull;
025import static com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkState;
026
027/**
028 * Base module class for element configuration modules.
029 * <p>
030 * In more complex projects with multiple {@link Jdbi} definitions, there are often elements (e.g. mappers or plugins) that should be shared between all
031 * instances.
032 * <p>
033 * Modules that extend {@link AbstractJdbiConfigurationModule} bind Jdbi related elements such as mappers, plugins, codecs etc. which then are used by Jdbi
034 * definition modules (which extend {@link AbstractJdbiDefinitionModule}). Any binding that is defined here will be added to any Jdbi definition as long as they
035 * either use the same configuration annotation. By default (unless using the constructors that explicitly take an annotation), all Jdbi definitions have all
036 * configurations assigned.
037 * <p>
038 * This module does neither define a Jdbi binding nor requires a data source to be bound. Jdbi instances are defined in modules extending {@link
039 * AbstractJdbiDefinitionModule} (which are private guice modules).
040 */
041public abstract class AbstractJdbiConfigurationModule extends AbstractModule implements JdbiBinder {
042
043    private InternalJdbiBinder jdbiBinder;
044    private final Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass;
045
046    /**
047     * Creates an element configuration module.
048     * <p>
049     * All elements defined in this module will be bound using the {@link JdbiGlobal} annotation. This is the used by {@link AbstractJdbiDefinitionModule}
050     * instances unless a custom annotation is used.
051     */
052    public AbstractJdbiConfigurationModule() {
053        this(JdbiGlobal.class);
054    }
055
056    /**
057     * Creates an element configuration module with a custom annotation.
058     * <p>
059     * All elements defined in this module will be bound using the given custom annotation. This allows creating multiple sets of element configuration modules
060     * which can be referenced from modules extending the  {@link AbstractJdbiDefinitionModule} base class if a the same custom annotation is used.
061     */
062    public AbstractJdbiConfigurationModule(Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass) {
063        this.annotationClass = checkNotNull(annotationClass, "annotationClass is null");
064    }
065
066    @Override
067    protected final void configure() {
068        jdbiBinder = InternalJdbiBinder.jdbiBinder(binder(), annotationClass);
069
070        try {
071            install(InternalGlobalJdbiModule.forAnnotation(annotationClass));
072
073            configureJdbi();
074        } finally {
075            jdbiBinder = null;
076        }
077    }
078
079    /**
080     * Override this method to create bindings that will be used in Jdbi definition modules.
081     */
082    public abstract void configureJdbi();
083
084    /**
085     * Provides access to the {@link JdbiBinder} instance.
086     * <p>
087     * Only valid when called from {@link AbstractJdbiConfigurationModule#configureJdbi}.
088     */
089    @Override
090    public final JdbiBinder jdbiBinder() {
091        checkState(jdbiBinder != null, "The jdbiBinder can only be used inside configureJdbi()");
092        return jdbiBinder;
093    }
094}
